Database

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • Database.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores all information of the user for gameplay, account management, and interface interactions by generating a CSV. All account information is read and written to and from the CSV. Internal methods format and manage the data to be modified or displayed elsewhere.
    Author:
    Olivier Laforest, Eric Liou

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Database()
      Constructs a new database where the information of all accounts is read from the CSV and stored within the instance.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Player addPlayer(Player newPlayer)
      Adds newPlayer into the database
      void deletePlayer()
      Removes a player account from the database
      void editPassword(java.lang.String password)
      Modifies the password of the current logged in player
      void editRealName(java.lang.String realName)
      Modifies the real name of the current player
      void generateCSV()
      Creates a new CSV
      Player getPlayer(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Searches the database for an existing account that has the same username and password as input parameters
      java.util.ArrayList<Player> sortPlayers()
      Sorts all players and returns the top 10 players with the highest cumulative score

        Constructs a new database where the information of all accounts is read from the CSV and stored within the instance.

    • Method Detail

      • generateCSV

        public void generateCSV()
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.net.URISyntaxException
        Creates a new CSV
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when data from or to the CSV is invalid(null)
        java.net.URISyntaxException - thrown when data to or from the CSV is imporperly formated

      • addPlayer

        public Player addPlayer(Player newPlayer)
        Adds newPlayer into the database
        Parameters:
        newPlayer - New player to be stored
        Returns:
        newPlayer as the currently logged in account

      • deletePlayer

        public void deletePlayer()
        Removes a player account from the database

      • editRealName

        public void editRealName(java.lang.String realName)
        Modifies the real name of the current player
        Parameters:
        realName - New name which current player's name is updated to

      • editPassword

        public void editPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Modifies the password of the current logged in player
        Parameters:
        password - New password which current player's password is updated to

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer(java.lang.String username,
               java.lang.String password)
        Searches the database for an existing account that has the same username and password as input parameters
        Parameters:
        username - The username which is searched
        password - The password which is searched
        Returns:
        Returns the player if an account exists that contains the input parameters. Else returns null

      • sortPlayers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> sortPlayers()
        Sorts all players and returns the top 10 players with the highest cumulative score
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of the top 10 highest scoring players
